Description: A terracotta horse couchant, its front legs appear to be stretched out forward but are possibly bent back at the knees, with elaborate garlands round neck and between eyes: a racehorse. It is modelled in the round. Apparently solid; two-piece mould. Orange-brown Nile silt with a little mica; darker brown surface.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Roman, third or fourth century AD. Comparanda: Close: Pagenstecher 1923: 113, fig. 117:4; Hoffmann and Steinhart 2001: 62, no. 25: dated third to fourth century AD; Petrie Museum uc48055, from Memphis; Vogt 1924: pl. cv:2. Near: Allen 1985: no. 39, from Karanis, dated early fourth century ad, and nos 40-2, dated mid to late fourth century AD; Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1872.414, acquired by the vendor in the Fayum, and no.1975.422; Bayer-Niemeier 1988: nos 618-20, dated third to fourth century AD; Breccia 1926: pl. lxxi:9–10, from Theadelphia; Fischer 1994: no. 1113, dated third to fourth century AD = Vogt 1924: pl. cv:3; Petrie Museum uc48055, from Memphis; Petrie Museum uc49891, a larger and more elaborate version, from the Fayum; Szyma´nska 2005: no. 257, from Athribis, dated third to fourth century AD; Weber 1914: no. 440, purchased at Thebes.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3753)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
